definition: a pool of stagnant water/stagnant or listless condition
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes

sentences.english: Still water and still religion freeze the quickest.
sentences.chinese: 一潭死水和死寂的宗教冰凍得最快。

sentences.english: Do you think America's plutocracy is becoming stale?
sentences.chinese: 你認爲美國富豪階層正在成爲一潭死水嗎？

sentences.english: Today the backwater has turned into Niagara Falls.
sentences.chinese: 在今天，那過去的一潭死水已蛻變爲尼亞加拉瀑布。

sentences.english: And my soul was a stagnant tide.
Ofcourse, love needs romance and marriage is not a pond of stagnant water either.
sentences.chinese: 誠然，愛情需要浪漫，婚姻也不能是一潭死水。

sentences.english: Sometimes life is a pool of stagnant water, passion is your stones.
sentences.chinese: 生活有時候就是一潭死水，激情就是你手中的石子。

sentences.english: It's the difference between running and stagnant water.
sentences.chinese: 這是流動的活水與一潭死水的區別。

sentences.english: Sometimes life is a backwater, passion is you stones in his hand.
sentences.chinese: 生活有時候就是一潭死水，激情就是你手中的石子。

definition: to lose all interest in life (idiom)
billows/great waves (fig. of a story with great momentum)
to drift with the waves and go with the flow (idiom); to follow the crowd blindly
one climax follows another (of thrilling story)
lit. breeze is still, waves are quiet (idiom); tranquil environment/all is quiet/a dead calm (at sea)
thousands of horses, all mute (idiom); no-one dares to speak out/an atmosphere of political oppression
to disappear like a stone dropped into the sea/to vanish forever without trace
